screen_desc: The screenshot shows the Google Play Store's search interface. It displays recent search history, including "LinkedIn," "Zoom Cloud Meetings for Android," "Reddit," and "Cash App." Each item has an icon indicating the app and an arrow suggesting you can click to search or view more. The search bar at the top allows further searches. The time at the top indicates when the screenshot was taken.
history_actions: click on the "Google Chrome" app located at the lower left.
click on the search icon (typically a magnifier) located at the top-right corner of the screen.
click on the search clear icon (indicated by an "X") located at the top right.

think.Thought: The current screen shows the Google Play Store's search interface, where recent search history is listed. The next step is to search for 'Google Translate' in the Play Store to proceed with its uninstallation. Since the user has already searched for 'Google Translate,' I will focus on locating it in the search results to move forward with uninstalling the app.
Future Action Plan: Type 'Google Translate' in the search bar and press search to find the app.
Locate the 'Google Translate' app from the search results.
Tap on the 'Google Translate' app to open its details page.
Click on the 'Uninstall' button on the app details page to uninstall it.
